definition: to resemble/to be like/to look as if/such as/appearance/image/portrait/image under a mapping (math.)

sentences.english: By drawing on his own culture, Jesus shared his vision of the kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 耶穌也通過汲取自身文化來分享他對上帝國的異像。

sentences.english: You have had the vision, but you are not there yet by any means.
sentences.chinese: 你們雖然看到了異像，卻還沒有到達那裏。

sentences.english: And this phenomenon was accompanied by visions and trances .
sentences.chinese: 這種現象是伴隨着異像和出神狀態而來。

sentences.english: Moreover, he openly laughed at Sri Ramakrishna's visions as hallucinations .
sentences.chinese: 他公然地嘈笑室利羅摩克里希納的異像是幻覺。

sentences.english: Day and night, visions flitted before him.
sentences.chinese: 異像在他面前日日夜夜地掠過。
